intro: Cyclanthera brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian bitter apple, is a climbing vine native to South America. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant produces small, bitter green fruits that are typically harvested when they are still unripe. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with five petals. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in humid, shaded environments.
